for Media Innovation Base Camp

Brown Institute Base Camp

Have an idea that can transform how we communicate online, how we share and receive information, and how we tell stories? Want to develop ideas for technology that will shape the future of media?

Applications due October 28?

  • Apply now

Winter Base Camp

January 13-15, 2017

*All expenses will be paid to and around the Base Camp locations.

Bridging the future of media and tech

Are you passionate about the role that emerging technologies can play in the future of storytelling and journalism? Do you have a story that can only be told using technology outside the scope of traditional media? If so, you might be a perfect candidate for a Magic Grant from the Brown Institute for Media Innovation.

At Base Camp, you will work in interdisciplinary, bicoastal teams to develop new ideas and plans for media innovation that may result in Magic Grant projects. Brown Fellows, industry experts and faculty will be on hand to provide feedback, support and guidance.

You don't need a concrete idea or team to participate--interest in media innovation is what we're looking for! Take a look at last year's projects to see the variety of work we fund, then connect with possible teammates and their ideas on the Base Camp Github repo.

About The Brown Institute

Established in 2012, the David and Helen Gurley Brown Institute is a collaboration between Columbia University and Stanford University, designed to encourage and support new endeavors in media innovation.

What?

Your media innovation can be about civic technology, computer-mediated communication, online collaboration, fighting corruption, virtual or augmented reality, visual search... you name it, we can fund it!

Who?

All student levels: undergraduate, graduate and postdoctoral

Why?

Shape the future of media and impact society through media innovations

Funding

Magic Grants provide up to $300,000 for student projects

Apply now
